item.title: 人工智能数据中心初创企业克鲁索（Crusoe）在最新一轮融资中募集资金 13.8 亿美元
item.description: 人工智能数据中心初创公司克鲁索（Crusoe）周四表示，预计将在 E 轮融资中筹集 13.8 亿美元，估值约为 100 亿美元。【原文：AI data centre startup Crusoe is raising $1.38 billion at a valuation of about $10 billion from an anticipated Series E funding round, the Denver-based company said on Thursday】

item.title: 数据中心公司 Equinix 拓展巴西市场，将其视为优先市场，总监如是说
item.description: 美国数据中心运营商 Equinix 拉丁美洲常务董事 Eduardo Zago 周四表示，Equinix 正在扩大其在巴西的业务，该公司视巴西为优先市场。【原文：U.S. data center operator Equinix is expanding its operations in Brazil, which the firm sees as a priority market, its managing director for Latin America Eduardo Zago said on Thursday.】

item.title: 应用材料公司将裁员 4% 以简化运营
item.description: 芯片设备制造商应用材料公司（Applied Materials）周四表示，由于美国收紧半导体出口管制，该公司将裁员约 4%，即大约 1400 个工作岗位，以精简业务。【原文：Applied Materials will cut about 4% of its workforce, or roughly 1,400 jobs, to streamline operations, the chip equipment maker said on Thursday as tighter U.S. export controls on semiconductors weigh on its business.】

item.title: 交易日：中美缓和，石油大涨
item.description: 受中美贸易紧张局势降温的提振，美国和全球股市周四上涨；而在华盛顿制裁两家俄罗斯石油巨头，引发对全球供应的担忧后，油价大涨5%。【原文：U.S. and world stocks rose on Thursday, boosted by a cooling in U.S.-China trade tensions, while oil prices rocketed 5% after Washington sanctioned two Russian oil giants, raising concern about global supply.】

item.title: 贝克休斯利润超预期，工业和能源技术部门表现强劲
item.description: 油田服务供应商贝克休斯周四公布的第三季度利润超出华尔街预期，这主要得益于其工业和能源技术部门的强劲表现。【原文：Oilfield services provider Baker Hughes surpassed Wall Street expectations for third-quarter profit on Thursday, helped by strength in its industrial and energy technology unit.】

item.title: Anthropic 将使用 100 万个谷歌云 TPU 芯片训练其克劳德聊天机器人
item.description: Anthropic 公司周四表示，将使用价值数百亿美元的一百万个谷歌云张量处理单元对克劳德模型进行训练。【原文：Anthropic said on Thursday it Claude models would be trained using up to one million of Google Cloud's tensor processing units, worth tens of billions of dollars.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，塔吉特计划裁员 1800 人
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周四援引知情人士的话报道，作为扭转销售停滞战略的一部分，塔吉特计划裁员约 1800 人。【原文：Target plans to lay off around 1,800 employees as part of its strategy to reverse stagnant sales, the Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 独家报道公司备忘录显示康菲石油公司将于 11 月裁减加拿大员工
item.description: 根据路透社周四看到的一份备忘录，美国石油生产商康菲石油公司（ConocoPhillips）将于 11 月第一周开始在其加拿大业务部门裁员。【原文：U.S. oil producer ConocoPhillips will begin layoffs at its Canadian operations in the first week of November, according to a memo seen by Reuters on Thursday.】

item.title: 金矿开采商纽蒙特因金银上涨而季度利润超出预期
item.description: 纽蒙特公司周四公布的第三季度利润超过了华尔街预期，这家世界顶级金矿企业受益于金银价格的反弹。【原文：Newmont surpassed Wall Street expectations for third-quarter profit on Thursday, as the world's top gold miner benefited from a rally in bullion prices.】

item.title: 诺福克南方公司季度利润增长
item.description: 美国铁路运营商诺福克南方公司（Norfolk Southern）周四公布了第三季度利润增长，这是该公司宣布与联合太平洋公司（Union Pacific）达成一项价值 850 亿美元的交易，组建美国首家海岸至海岸货运铁路运营商后的首份财报。【原文：U.S. railroad operator Norfolk Southern posted a rise in third-quarter profit on Thursday, in its first earnings report after announcing an $85 billion deal to form the nation's first coast-to-coast freight rail operator with Union Pacific .】

item.title: 福特以供应商铝厂发生火灾为由下调年度指导目标
item.description: 福特汽车公司周四下调了利润预期，原因是一家重要的铝供应商发生火灾，这将在今年年底前抑制一些利润最高的汽车的生产。【原文：Ford Motor cut its profit guidance on Thursday, citing fallout from a fire at a critical aluminum supplier that will crimp production of some of its most lucrative vehicles through the end of the year.】

item.title: 英特尔第三季度利润超预期，成本削减和投资初见成效
item.description: 英特尔公司周四预计第四季度营收略低于预期，但 9 月份的利润超出预期，原因是该公司首席执行官陈立武采取了大幅削减成本的措施，帮助这家芯片制造商在一系列备受瞩目的投资活动中巩固了财务状况。【原文：Intel forecast fourth-quarter revenue just shy of estimates on Thursday, but beat expectations for September-quarter profit as CEO Lip-Bu Tan's drastic cost-cutting measures helped the chipmaker shore up its finances amid a slew of high-profile investments in the company.】

item.title: 可口可乐出售非洲装瓶厂股份将产生 10 亿美元费用
item.description: 饮料生产商可口可乐公司周四在提交给监管机构的文件中表示，预计将在 2025 年第四季度计提约 10 亿美元的减值费用，这笔费用与出售其在非洲装瓶业务中的部分权益有关。【原文：Coca-Cola expects to take an impairment charge of about $1 billion during the fourth quarter of 2025 related to the sale of a part of its interest in bottling operations in Africa, the beverage maker said in regulatory filing on Thursday.】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，高盛接近以 10 亿美元收购 Excel Sports 的多数股权
item.description: 英国《金融时报》周四援引两位熟悉内情的人士的话报道称，高盛（Goldman Sachs）即将以约 10 亿美元的价格收购艺人经纪公司 Excel Sports 的多数股权。【原文：Goldman Sachs is nearing a deal to buy a majority stake in talent agency Excel Sports for about $1 billion, the Financial Times reported on Thursday, citing two people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 亚马逊设备部门本月失去第二位副总裁
item.description: 一位在亚马逊设备部门工作了 15 年、参与开发了许多最知名小工具的资深员工将于 10 月底离开公司，这也是亚马逊在 10 月份的第二次高层离职。【原文：A fifteen-year veteran of Amazon’s devices division who had a hand in developing many of the most recognizable gadgets is leaving the company at the end of October, marking the second high-level departure in October.】

item.title: 阿根廷总统米莱伊将于本周会见摩根大通首席执行官戴蒙
item.description: 据三位熟悉内情的消息人士透露，阿根廷总统哈维尔-米莱伊将于本周在布宜诺斯艾利斯会见摩根大通首席执行官杰米-戴蒙。【原文：Argentine President Javier Milei will meet with JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon in Buenos Aires this week, according to three sources familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 纽约州主计长：华尔街丰收年将促进税收增长
item.description: 纽约州主计长办公室在一份报告中称，华尔街今年有望再获丰收，其证券交易和承销利润预计将超过 600 亿美元。【原文：Wall Street is on track for another bumper year, with its profit from securities trading and underwriting expected to exceed $60 billion, the Office of the New York State Comptroller said in a report.】

item.title: NioCorp 与洛克希德合作开展五角大楼资助的钪合金工作
item.description: 稀土矿商 NioCorp 周四表示，该公司正与美国国防承包商洛克希德-马丁公司（Lockheed Martin）合作，开发一种用于军事装备的钪铝合金，这是五角大楼资助项目的一部分。【原文：Rare earths miner NioCorp said on Thursday it is working with U.S. defense contractor Lockheed Martin to develop a scandium and aluminum alloy for use in military equipment as part of a Pentagon‑funded program.】

item.title: 密歇根州称与中国有关联的电池公司放弃在密歇根建厂的计划
item.description: 美国密歇根州周四表示，中国电池公司Gotion的一家子公司已经放弃了在密歇根州建造一座耗资24亿美元、生产电动汽车电池关键材料的工厂的计划。【原文：A subsidiary of Chinese battery company Gotion has abandoned a plan to build a $2.4 billion plant in Michigan to produce key materials for electric vehicle batteries, the state said on Thursday.】

item.title: 两名联邦法官称人工智能的使用导致美国法院判决错误
item.description: 两名联邦法官在回答美国参议院司法委员会主席查克-格拉斯利（Chuck Grassley）的询问时承认，他们的工作人员使用人工智能来帮助准备最近被格拉斯利称为 "错误百出 "的法庭命令。【原文：Two federal judges admitted in response to an inquiry by U.S. Senate Judiciary Committee Chairman Chuck Grassley that members of their staff used artificial intelligence to help prepare recent court orders that Grassley called "error-ridden."】

item.title: 微软推出协作和谷歌集成等新 Copilot 功能
item.description: 微软周四推出了数字助理 Copilot 的新功能，如协作以及与 Outlook 和谷歌等其他服务的深度整合，从而加强了其人工智能服务，以抵御竞争对手的冲击。【原文：Microsoft on Thursday introduced new features in its digital assistant Copilot such as collaboration and deeper integration with other services like Outlook and Google, beefing up its artificial intelligence service to stave off a hit from its competition.】

item.title: 苹果在英国应用程序商店佣金诉讼中败诉
item.description: 苹果公司周四在伦敦的一场诉讼中败诉，该诉讼指控这家美国科技公司滥用其主导地位，通过其应用商店向应用开发者收取 30% 的不公平佣金。【原文：Apple on Thursday lost a London lawsuit accusing the U.S. tech company of abusing its dominant position by charging app developers an unfair 30% commission through its app store.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，专注于公用事业的 Conservice 公司的所有者正在探讨出售事宜，估值高达 50 亿美元
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，Advent International 和 TA Associates 正在探讨出售公用事业管理和计费公司 Conservice，其估值可能在 45 亿至 50 亿美元之间。【原文：Advent International and TA Associates are exploring the sale of utility management and billing company Conservice that could value it at between $4.5 billion and $5 billion, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 特朗普赦免被定罪的 Binance 创始人 "CZ "赵某
item.description: 美国白宫周四表示，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普已赦免了被定罪的 Binance 加密货币交易所创始人赵长鹏，这是特朗普为促进加密货币行业发展和消除其过去的不端行为而采取的最新举措。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump has pardoned Changpeng Zhao, the convicted founder of the Binance cryptocurrency exchange, the White House said Thursday, in the latest move by Trump to boost the crypto industry and expunge its past misdeeds.】

item.title: 科威特大臣称，美国制裁俄罗斯后，欧佩克准备在必要时提高石油产量
item.description: 科威特石油部长周四表示，在美国对俄罗斯石油巨头实施新制裁后，欧佩克准备在必要时通过进一步削减石油产量来提高产量，以解决市场短缺问题。【原文：OPEC is ready to raise production by rolling back its oil output cuts further if required to address market shortfalls after the United States imposed new sanctions on Russian oil majors, Kuwait's oil minister said on Thursday.】

item.title: 卡尼表示，如果贸易谈判失败，加拿大不会允许美国以不公平的方式进入市场
item.description: 加拿大总理马克-卡尼（Mark Carney）周四告诉记者，如果与华盛顿的各种贸易协议谈判最终失败，加拿大将不会允许美国以不公平的方式进入其市场。【原文：Canada will not allow unfair U.S. access to its markets if talks on various trade deals with Washington ultimately fail, Prime Minister Mark Carney told reporters on Thursday.】

item.title: 合同谈判陷入僵局，星巴克工会将开始罢工投票
item.description: 星巴克咖啡师工会周四表示，将投票决定是否授权在有工会组织的场所举行不公平劳动行为罢工，以要求公司回到谈判桌前。【原文：Starbucks baristas' union said on Thursday it would vote on whether to authorize an unfair labor practice strike at unionized locations to demand that the company return to the negotiating table.】

item.title: Ortex 数据显示，Beyond Meat 的空头兴趣飙升，超过上市股票的 100
item.description: Ortex周四的数据显示，植物肉类销售商Beyond Meat的股票空头兴趣飙升，超过其公开发行股票的100%。【原文：Short interest in shares of plant-based meat seller Beyond Meat surged more than 100% of its publicly available shares, Ortex data showed on Thursday.】

item.title: 尽管贸易关系紧张，加航仍押注从多伦多飞往美国的新商务航线
item.description: 尽管多伦多和美国之间的贸易关系紧张，但加拿大航空公司（Air Canada）仍将赌注押在商务旅行上，以支持多伦多市中心机场服务的扩展，并将开通飞往美国的新航线，从而促进跨境飞行。【原文：Air Canada is betting on business travel to support an expansion of service from Toronto's downtown airport, with new routes to the United States, in a boost for cross-border flying despite trade tensions between the two countries.】

item.title: 隐私权判决后，消费者要求谷歌赔偿 23.6 亿美元
item.description: 在上个月的消费者隐私集体诉讼中，谷歌用户赢得了陪审团4.25亿美元的裁决，他们要求联邦法官迫使Alphabet公司再没收23.6亿美元的利润。【原文：U.S. Google users who won a $425 million jury verdict in a consumer privacy class action last month have asked a federal judge to force the Alphabet unit to forfeit an additional $2.36 billion in profits.】
